titles.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to limit terms of Representatives and Senators.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on the Constitution.

bill.summary: 1/21/1997--Introduced. Constitutional Amendment - Prohibits a person from being elected to serve more than three consecutive terms in the House of Representatives or more than two consecutive terms in the Senate. Excludes elections occurring before ratification of this article in determining the number of times a person has been elected.
